translated: We are also not harmed by what is renowned to us.üîΩFor example, it is like the following analogy: A clear and sharp eye, a precious jewel, is not realized by a blind man or by someone whose eye is impaired by cataracts. analyzed: rmi lam bzhin no zhes pa'i dpe de yang 'di ltar brtags pa'i don gyis stong pa yin nam /
translated: And the example, ‚Äúlike a dream,‚Äù is either an example of an empty object that is examined in this way

original: 'on te brtags pa ma yin pa'i don gyis stong pa'i dpe yin /
analyzed: 'on te brtags pa ma yin pa'i don gyis stong pa'i dpe yin /
translated: or it is an example of an empty object that is not examined.

original: 'di yin na shes pa dang / shes bya mi 'grub cing brdzun par 'gyur bas khyed kyi grub pa'i mtha' nyid nyams so //
analyzed: 'di yin na shes pa dang / shes bya mi 'grub cing brdzun par 'gyur bas khyed kyi grub pa'i mtha' nyid nyams so //
translated: If it is the former, then consciousness and objects of consciousness are not established and they become false, and so your tenets are undermined.

original: brtags pa'i don gyis stong pa'i dpe yin na ni /
analyzed: brtags pa'i don gyis stong pa'i dpe yin na ni /
translated: If the example is empty of the object of investigation,

original: brtags pa ma yin pa'i don gyi cha de sel bar mi byed pas sems tsam nyid du yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: brtags pa ma yin pa'i don gyi cha de sel bar mi byed pas sems tsam nyid du yang mi rung ngo //
translated: then it does not eliminate the part of the object that is not investigated, and so it is not suitable as mere mind.

original: dpe 'di yang ma grub ste /
analyzed: dpe 'di yang ma grub ste /
translated: This example is also not established.

original: rmi lam gyi shes pa ni chos nyid kyi gzugs la dmigs pa'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir dpe nyid du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi shes pa ni chos nyid kyi gzugs la dmigs pa'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir dpe nyid du mi rung ngo //
translated: Because the consciousness of a dream is not real because it observes a form that is the reality of a dream, it is not suitable as an example.

original: 'di la yul du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la yul du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the consciousness that appears as an object.

original: rnam par shes pa skye bzhin pa nyid kyi yul rtogs par mi byed pa'i phyir shes pa skye bzhin pa nyid gang yin pa de ni tshad mar 'dod do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skye bzhin pa nyid kyi yul rtogs par mi byed pa'i phyir shes pa skye bzhin pa nyid gang yin pa de ni tshad mar 'dod do //
translated: Because the consciousness that is in the process of arising does not understand the object, that which is the consciousness that is in the process of arising is asserted to be valid knowledge.

original: rnam par shes pa skyes pa na yul mthong ba'i phyir shes pa de mngon par grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skyes pa na yul mthong ba'i phyir shes pa de mngon par grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the object is seen when the consciousness has arisen, that consciousness is established.

original: de ni 'bras bu'i yul du snang ba'i shes pa nyid la tshad ma dang / 'bras bu nyid yod par 'dod de /
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu'i yul du snang ba'i shes pa nyid la tshad ma dang / 'bras bu nyid yod par 'dod de /
translated: Therefore, the valid knowledge and the object that appears as the result exist in the consciousness that is the result.

original: dper na shing la sta res gzas pa dang / btab pa'i rkyen gyis gnyis su gcod par byed pa dang / des dum bu gnyis su gyur pa bzhin no zhes zer ro ;
analyzed: dper na shing la sta res gzas pa dang / btab pa'i rkyen gyis gnyis su gcod par byed pa dang / des dum bu gnyis su gyur pa bzhin no zhes zer ro ;
translated: For example, it is like the axe that cuts the tree, and the conditions of the axe and the tree cause the tree to be cut into two pieces, and the tree becomes two pieces.

original: / de la brjod pa /üîΩmngon sum gyi shes pa dngos po rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa dang / rtog pa dang / rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas gzugs la sogs pa sngon po la sogs pa gtan du med pa'i ngo bo nyid la /
analyzed: / de la brjod pa / mngon sum gyi shes pa dngos po rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa dang / rtog pa dang / rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas gzugs la sogs pa sngon po la sogs pa gtan du med pa'i ngo bo nyid la /
translated: To this we reply:üîΩThe direct perception consciousness observes the entity‚Äôs own character, and because it is free from conceptuality and memory, it is like the axe that cuts the tree.

original: de bzhin du gtan du med pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na bzhin du @269b rang rig pa'i rnam par rtog par byed pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du gtan du med pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na bzhin du @269b rang rig pa'i rnam par rtog par byed pa /
translated: The conceptual consciousness that is self-awareness is like the axe that cuts the tree, and the conditions of the axe and the tree cause the tree to be cut into two pieces, and the tree becomes two pieces.

original: de dag gi phyir de'i phyi'i yul nyid du bsnad pa'i shes pa gcig pu kho na la tshad ma dang / 'bras bu gnyis yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pas sems gcig pu gnyis su snang bar rtogs pa ni 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi phyir de'i phyi'i yul nyid du bsnad pa'i shes pa gcig pu kho na la tshad ma dang / 'bras bu gnyis yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pas sems gcig pu gnyis su snang bar rtogs pa ni 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: For that reason, because the single consciousness that is the object of the external object is the only valid knowledge and the only effect, the reason is not established. Therefore it is a mistake to think that a single consciousness appears as two.

original: rigs pa gsum pa yang mi bden par smras te /
analyzed: rigs pa gsum pa yang mi bden par smras te /
translated: The third reasoning is also stated falsely.

original: 'di ltar chos can dang / de sgrub pa'i chos dam bca' ba dang / gtan tshigs dang / dpe rnams te /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos can dang / de sgrub pa'i chos dam bca' ba dang / gtan tshigs dang / dpe rnams te /
translated: Thus, the subject, the thesis that proves that, the reason, and the example‚Äî

original: khyed kyis dam bca' ba yang nged la ma grub la /
analyzed: khyed kyis dam bca' ba yang nged la ma grub la /
translated: your thesis is not established for us.

original: sems nyid kyi yul yin pa'i phyir zhes pa de yang sems phyi rol na yod na yul yin nam /
analyzed: sems nyid kyi yul yin pa'i phyir zhes pa de yang sems phyi rol na yod na yul yin nam /
translated: If the mind exists externally, is it an object?

original: 'on te tshor ba la sogs pa nang na gnas pa la yul yin /
analyzed: 'on te tshor ba la sogs pa nang na gnas pa la yul yin /
translated: Or is it an object that exists internally, such as feeling?

original: phyi rol gyi sems yul yin na dam bca' ba'i skabs su phyi nang thams cad sems nyid du 'dod pas yul dang yul can nyid du mi rigs so //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi sems yul yin na dam bca' ba'i skabs su phyi nang thams cad sems nyid du 'dod pas yul dang yul can nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: If the external mind is an object, it is not logical for there to be an object and an agent of perception, because in the context of the thesis, you assert that all external and internal things are the mind itself.

original: nang gi sems kyang nang gi sems kyi yul du mi rigs te /
analyzed: nang gi sems kyang nang gi sems kyi yul du mi rigs te /
translated: Also, the internal mind is not logical as an object of the internal mind.

original: gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: This is a fallacious reason.

original: gzhan yang 'di lta bu'i skyon yang yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di lta bu'i skyon yang yod de /
translated: Moreover, there is this kind of error.

original: thams cad sems nyid yin par gyur na /
analyzed: thams cad sems nyid yin par gyur na /
translated: If everything were the mind itself,

original: dper na bum pa mthong ba'i dus su sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyud kyang mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dper na bum pa mthong ba'i dus su sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyud kyang mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: For example, when a pot is seen, the mindstreams of all sentient beings would also be seen.

original: de mthong bas 'gro ba lnga po la gzhan gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yang rang chas su yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de mthong bas 'gro ba lnga po la gzhan gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yang rang chas su yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: And because of seeing that, the superknowledge of knowing the minds of others with regard to the five classes of transmigrating beings would exist naturally.

original: gzhan yang thams cad sems yin na rnam pa yang sems bzhin du gzugs can ma yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan yang thams cad sems yin na rnam pa yang sems bzhin du gzugs can ma yin par 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, if everything is mind, then like the mind, the aspects would not be physical.

original: sems kyang rnam pa bzhin du gzugs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems kyang rnam pa bzhin du gzugs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: And like the aspects, the mind would be physical.

original: de bzhin du sems kyang rnam pa bzhin du bems por 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems kyang rnam pa bzhin du bems por 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: Likewise, the mind would be matter like the aspects,

original: rnam pa yang rig pa dang shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa yang rig pa dang shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: or the aspects would be cognition and consciousness.

original: nam zhig gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dri ma dang bral nas zhes bya ba'i thar pa yang khyed la mi 'thad de /
analyzed: nam zhig gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dri ma dang bral nas zhes bya ba'i thar pa yang khyed la mi 'thad de /
translated: Also, liberation, which is the freedom from the stains of percepts and perceivers, is untenable for you.

original: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi yul yod par 'dod pa la ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi yul yod par 'dod pa la ni /
translated: This is because those who assert that external objects exist

original: rnal 'byor pas yul ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pas /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas yul ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pas /
translated: are yogis who realize that objects lack entityness.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rtogs pa'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur ba ni rigs pa kho nar 'gyur gyi /üîΩkhyed yul med par 'dod pa la ni dang po nyid nas phyi rol gyi don med la phyis kyang de bzhin du gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'jug par 'gyur ba de phyis rgyu gang gis bzlog /'jig rten las 'das @270a * //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rtogs pa'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur ba ni rigs pa kho nar 'gyur gyi / khyed yul med par 'dod pa la ni dang po nyid nas phyi rol gyi don med la phyis kyang de bzhin du gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'jug par 'gyur ba de phyis rgyu gang gis bzlog /'jig rten las 'das @270a * //
translated: Therefore, it is only reasonable that the supramundane, nonconceptual wisdom would arise in order to realize the object and subject.

original: pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur ba'i thabs ci yang med do //
analyzed: pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur ba'i thabs ci yang med do //
translated: But for you who assert that objects do not exist, from the very beginning there are no external objects, and later on as well, one would engage in the nature of the object and subject. What cause would there be later on to stop that? There is no way at all that the supramundane, nonconceptual wisdom would arise.

original: de bas na khyed 'di skad du /
analyzed: de bas na khyed 'di skad du /
translated: Therefore, you should say this:

original: gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa'i dmigs pa rnams sems las phyi rol na mi snang ba de'i tshe rang gi sems kyi chos nyid la nges par gnas pa'i sems ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa'i dmigs pa rnams sems las phyi rol na mi snang ba de'i tshe rang gi sems kyi chos nyid la nges par gnas pa'i sems ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes zhes bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen the objects such as form do not appear as external to the mind, at that time the mind that definitely abides in the nature of its own mind is called the wisdom of nonduality.‚Äù

original: de kho na nyid dang / yang dag pa dang / 'chi ba med pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi go 'phang mthar thug pa sku gsum gyi bdag nyid yin no zhes bya ba de ni log par rtogs pa yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid dang / yang dag pa dang / 'chi ba med pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi go 'phang mthar thug pa sku gsum gyi bdag nyid yin no zhes bya ba de ni log par rtogs pa yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is a wrong view to say that the ultimate, the real, the immortal, the nature of the three bodies, the final state of all buddhas, does not exist.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa med par smra ba dag la yang don dam pa'i shes pa med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa med par smra ba dag la yang don dam pa'i shes pa med de /
translated: Thus, even for those who advocate the absence of aspects, there is no ultimate consciousness.

original: 'di skad du smra ste /
analyzed: 'di skad du smra ste /
translated: They say this:

original: 'di dag rnam par rig tsam nyid //
analyzed: 'di dag rnam par rig tsam nyid //
translated: These are mere representations,

original: yod pa ma yin don snang phyir //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin don snang phyir //
translated: because non-existent objects appear.

original: dper na rab rib can dag gis //
analyzed: dper na rab rib can dag gis //
translated: For example, those with eye disease

original: skra zla la sogs med mthong bzhin //
analyzed: skra zla la sogs med mthong bzhin //
translated: see non-existent hairs and moons.

original: zhes gzhung 'dzugs par byed do //
analyzed: zhes gzhung 'dzugs par byed do //
translated: This is their position.

original: rigs pa'i tshogs kyis yul gyi rnam pa brdzun par bsgrub cing /
analyzed: rigs pa'i tshogs kyis yul gyi rnam pa brdzun par bsgrub cing /
translated: They establish by a collection of reasonings that the aspects of objects are false,

original: shes pa dang / ye shes dag don dam par yod par 'dod do //
analyzed: shes pa dang / ye shes dag don dam par yod par 'dod do //
translated: and they assert that consciousness and wisdom ultimately exist.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not reasonable.

original: 'di ltar rigs pa dang / lung dag gis phyi rol gyi rnam pa brdzun par grub pa nang gi shes pa yang brdzun par grub la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rigs pa dang / lung dag gis phyi rol gyi rnam pa brdzun par grub pa nang gi shes pa yang brdzun par grub la /
translated: In this way, it is established by reasoning and by scriptural authority that external features are false, and it is also established that internal consciousness is false.

original: ji ltar shes pa bden pa ltar rnam pa yang bden pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar shes pa bden pa ltar rnam pa yang bden pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If consciousness were true, then its features would also be true.

original: gzhan yang khyed rang rig pa zhes bya ba zhig yod par 'dod ces grag na /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed rang rig pa zhes bya ba zhig yod par 'dod ces grag na /
translated: Moreover, it is well known that you assert that there is something called reflexive awareness.

original: de brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: de brtag par bya ste /
translated: This should be examined.

original: rig par bya ba dang / rig pa po dang / rig pa zhes bya ba gsum las khyed kyis rig par bya ba ni ji lta bu zhig yin /
analyzed: rig par bya ba dang / rig pa po dang / rig pa zhes bya ba gsum las khyed kyis rig par bya ba ni ji lta bu zhig yin /
translated: Among the three‚Äîthe object of awareness, the knower, and the act of knowing‚Äîwhat is the object of awareness for you?

original: rig pa po ni ji lta bu zhig yin /
analyzed: rig pa po ni ji lta bu zhig yin /
translated: What is the knower?

original: de gnyis ma gtogs pa'i rig pa zhes bya ba des ji lta bu zhig rig nas rang rig pa yin /
analyzed: de gnyis ma gtogs pa'i rig pa zhes bya ba des ji lta bu zhig rig nas rang rig pa yin /
translated: Apart from those two, what is the so-called act of knowing? What is it that knows and is reflexive awareness?

original: de bas na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don dang mi ldan pas sangs rgyas kyi ye shes su yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de bas na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don dang mi ldan pas sangs rgyas kyi ye shes su yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, since it is not the meaning of the term ‚Äúthe wisdom that knows all aspects,‚Äù how could it be the wisdom of a buddha?

original: khyed nyid kyi rigs pas gtan la phab pa'i don de dag la ser sna mi byed par yang ston cig / gal te 'dir rang rig pa yin pas gzhan la bstan par mi nus so zer na /
analyzed: khyed nyid kyi rigs pas gtan la phab pa'i don de dag la ser sna mi byed par yang ston cig / gal te 'dir rang rig pa yin pas gzhan la bstan par mi nus so zer na /
translated: Do not be stingy with the meaning that you have ascertained through reasoning and teach it to others.üîΩIf you say, ‚ÄúSince this is reflexive awareness, I cannot teach it to others,‚Äù

original: ji ltar phyi rol pas 'dod pa'i bdag dang khyad par med de /
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol pas 'dod pa'i bdag dang khyad par med de /
translated: then there is no difference between you and the non-Buddhists.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: This is becauseüîΩthe non-Buddhists say,

original: bdag ni rtag pa /
analyzed: bdag ni rtag pa /
translated: ‚ÄúThe self is permanent,

original: gcig pu / khyab pa /
analyzed: gcig pu / khyab pa /
translated: one, omnipresent,üîΩand without a body.‚Äù

original: lus med pa'i zhes pa dang / 'di dang tshul mi 'dra ba ci yang med pas mkhas @270b pa su zhig 'di la yid ches par byed /
analyzed: lus med pa'i zhes pa dang / 'di dang tshul mi 'dra ba ci yang med pas mkhas @270b pa su zhig 'di la yid ches par byed /
translated: What wise person would believe in this?

original: rang rig pa zhes bya ba dang / bdag ces bya ba ming so sor btags pa tsam mo //
analyzed: rang rig pa zhes bya ba dang / bdag ces bya ba ming so sor btags pa tsam mo //
translated: The so-called reflexive awareness and the so-called self are mere imputations.

original: chos bdag med pa yang ma rtogs te /
analyzed: chos bdag med pa yang ma rtogs te /
translated: They have not realized the absence of a self-entity of phenomena

original: 'di nyid bdag tu 'dzin pa chen po yin pas so //
analyzed: 'di nyid bdag tu 'dzin pa chen po yin pas so //
translated: because this is a great clinging to a self.

original: gzhan yang skyon mang du yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang skyon mang du yod de /
translated: There are many other faults,

original: re zhig gzhag go //
analyzed: re zhig gzhag go //
translated: but I will leave it at that for now.

original: 'dir rnam pa med par smra ba phyir zlog par byed de /
analyzed: 'dir rnam pa med par smra ba phyir zlog par byed de /
translated: Here is a rebuttal of the proponents of the view that there are no aspects:

original: bdag la don dam pa'i shes rab yod do //
analyzed: bdag la don dam pa'i shes rab yod do //
translated: ‚ÄúI have ultimate wisdom.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar nges pa'i don ston pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
analyzed: 'di ltar nges pa'i don ston pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
translated: In this way, in the perfection of wisdom that teaches the definitive meaning,

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: it says:

original: byams pa byang chub sems dpa' gzugs kyi bye brag gdags pa rnam pa gsum gyis khong du chud par bya ste /üîΩ'di ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: byams pa byang chub sems dpa' gzugs kyi bye brag gdags pa rnam pa gsum gyis khong du chud par bya ste / 'di ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs so //
translated: Maitreya, bodhisattvas should understand form by means of three types of designations:üîΩthis is imputed form,

original: 'di ni rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs so //
translated: this is conceptually differentiated form,üîΩand this is the reality of form.

original: 'di ni chos nyid kyi gzugs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs pas chos kyi gzugs yul du byed pa'i ye shes don dam pa ni don dam pa'i shes rab yin no zhes so //
analyzed: 'di ni chos nyid kyi gzugs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs pas chos kyi gzugs yul du byed pa'i ye shes don dam pa ni don dam pa'i shes rab yin no zhes so //
translated: The wisdom that takes the form of reality as its object is ultimate wisdom.

original: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis drang ba'i don du gsungs pas don dam pa'i shes rab tu mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis drang ba'i don du gsungs pas don dam pa'i shes rab tu mi 'gyur ro //
translated: This is not ultimate wisdom because it is taught by the Bhagavat to be of provisional meaning.

original: blo gros 'bring po dag gis yang smra ba bsgrub bya sangs rgyas kyang nged kyi lugs la yod de /
analyzed: blo gros 'bring po dag gis yang smra ba bsgrub bya sangs rgyas kyang nged kyi lugs la yod de /
translated: Those of middling intelligence also say, ‚ÄúWe also have a buddha to be established as a speaker.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal snga nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal snga nas /
translated: The Bhagavat said:

original: 'du shes tsam yang spang ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'du shes tsam yang spang ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to abandon even the notion

original: rang gi ngo bo brjod du med //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo brjod du med //
translated: Its essence is inexpressible.

original: shes rab rang rig tsam la ni ;
analyzed: shes rab rang rig tsam la ni ;
translated: Wisdom is mere self-awareness,

original: / de la de bzhin gshegs zhes bya //üîΩzhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: / de la de bzhin gshegs zhes bya // zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: and that is called the TathƒÅgata.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: gnas 'di yongs su gyur pa yis //
analyzed: gnas 'di yongs su gyur pa yis //
translated: through the transformation of this basis,

original: 'jig rten 'das pa'i ye shes te //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'das pa'i ye shes te //
translated: there is supramundane wisdom,

original: de ni zag pa med dang dbyings //
analyzed: de ni zag pa med dang dbyings //
translated: the uncontaminated realm,

original: thub pa chen po'i chos kyi sku //üîΩnam zhig shes pas dmigs pa kun //
analyzed: thub pa chen po'i chos kyi sku // nam zhig shes pas dmigs pa kun //
translated: the dharmakƒÅya of the Great Sage.

original: mi dmigs de yi tshe na ni //
analyzed: mi dmigs de yi tshe na ni //
translated: When consciousness does not observe any object,

original: rnam par rig pa tsam la gnas //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam la gnas //
translated: at that time it abides in mere cognition.

original: gzung ba med pas de 'dzin med //
analyzed: gzung ba med pas de 'dzin med //
translated: Since there is no object, there is no subject.

original: gnas ni yongs su gyur pa yi //
analyzed: gnas ni yongs su gyur pa yi //
